I think I've seen one or two internship listings that offer academic credit instead of pay. There's also http://studyabroad.berkeley.edu/globalinternships

International students aren't allowed to work while they have a students visa, so having it for credits allows them to get around that. Someone correct me if i'm wrong, but I worked with a couple of international students and this is what I got from them.

I believe anyone can, however there's not really a legitimate reason to unless it's needed for a visa. Especially if you're referring to a summer internship, you would need to pay tuition in order to receive the credit. 

https://people.eecs.berkeley.edu/~hilfingr/cpt.html

Just wondering, is there any way for an American student to receive credit for internships? I've heard about that it for international students, but it seems to be only for international students. If so, why is it for international students only? Just curious.
history.subject: Are only international students able to receive credit for internships?
